page.title: 16FARMING SHEEP AND PIGS
page.content: Sheep farming is popular at this height above sea level.Some farmers keep sheep only in the winter months to fatten and then sell them.Others keep sheep all year round,breed their own animals and sell the fleeces.These are collected by Burtons at Fell Beck and then taken to The British Wool Marketing Board at Bradford.The wool is generally used for carpet making. Some farmers keep Jacob sheep to meet the present demand for suitable fleeces for home spinners,weavers and knitters. Breeds in the area are Suffolk,Masham,Swaledale,Leicester and Mule.Two farms keep pigs;Careless House Farm and Church Farm.Thirsk market is used for pigs.Most farmers do their own accounts monthly;one or two employ an accountant.
